title: John Chapter 10 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on John chapter 10 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: John Chapter 10 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of John Chapter 10.

questions.question: According to John 10:1, how does Jesus describe the one who climbs up some other way into the sheepfold?
options: A thief and a robber
A good shepherd
A porter
A stranger
questions.correctAnswer: A thief and a robber
questions.explanation: John 10:1 states that he who enters not by the door but climbs up another way is a thief and a robber.

questions.question: In John 10:3, what do the sheep do when they hear the shepherd's voice?
options: They follow him
They ignore him
They flee
They scatter
questions.correctAnswer: They follow him
questions.explanation: John 10:3 says the sheep hear his voice, he calls them by name and leads them out, so they follow him.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 10:5, the sheep will follow a stranger because they know his voice.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 10:5 states that the sheep will not follow a stranger but will flee from him because they do not know the voice of strangers.

questions.question: Who does Jesus say He is in John 10:7?
options: The door of the sheep
The hireling
A stranger
The wolf
questions.correctAnswer: The door of the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:7 records Jesus saying, 'I am the door of the sheep.'

questions.question: According to John 10:11, what is the role of the good shepherd?
options: He gives his life for the sheep
He flees from the wolf
He climbs up another way
He is a hireling
questions.correctAnswer: He gives his life for the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:11 clearly states that the good shepherd gives his life for the sheep.

questions.question: In John 10:12, what does the hireling do when he sees the wolf coming?
options: Leaves the sheep and flees
Fights the wolf
Calls the porter
Leads the sheep out
questions.correctAnswer: Leaves the sheep and flees
questions.explanation: John 10:12 explains that the hireling sees the wolf coming and leaves the sheep to be scattered.

questions.question: True or False: John 10:14 says Jesus knows His sheep and is known by them.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 10:14 states, 'I am the good shepherd, and know my sheep, and am known of mine.'

questions.question: According to John 10:16, what will happen to the other sheep not of this fold?
options: They shall hear His voice and become one fold
They will be left out
They will be scattered
They will be hired as shepherds
questions.correctAnswer: They shall hear His voice and become one fold
questions.explanation: John 10:16 states that other sheep will hear His voice and there will be one fold and one shepherd.

questions.question: What reason does Jesus give in John 10:17 for the Father's love for Him?
options: Because He lays down His life to take it again
Because He performs miracles
Because He teaches the law
Because He feeds the sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Because He lays down His life to take it again
questions.explanation: John 10:17 says the Father loves Jesus because He lays down His life that He might take it again.

questions.question: Fill in the blank from John 10:28: 'And I give unto them ________; and they shall never perish, neither shall any man pluck them out of my hand.'
options: eternal life
power
peace
salvation
questions.correctAnswer: eternal life
questions.explanation: John 10:28 states that Jesus gives eternal life to His sheep who shall never perish.

questions.question: According to John 10:30, what is the relationship between Jesus and the Father?
options: I and my Father are one
I am greater than my Father
My Father is a stranger
We are like sheep and shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: I and my Father are one
questions.explanation: John 10:30 records Jesus saying, 'I and my Father are one.'

questions.question: True or False: In John 10:31, the Jews responded to Jesus' words by taking up stones to stone Him.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 10:31 states that the Jews took up stones again to stone Jesus.

questions.question: What reason do the Jews give in John 10:33 for wanting to stone Jesus?
options: Blasphemy because He makes Himself God
For healing the sick
For teaching the law
For feeding the sheep
questions.correctAnswer: Blasphemy because He makes Himself God
questions.explanation: John 10:33 says the Jews wanted to stone Him for blasphemy and because He, being a man, made Himself God.

questions.question: Complete this verse from John 10:34: 'Is it not written in your law, I said, Ye are ________?'
options: gods
shepherds
strangers
wolves
questions.correctAnswer: gods
questions.explanation: John 10:34 quotes scripture saying, 'I said, Ye are gods.'

questions.question: According to John 10:41, what did many say about John the Baptist?
options: John did no miracle but his words about Jesus were true
John was a prophet
John was the Messiah
John was a hireling
questions.correctAnswer: John did no miracle but his words about Jesus were true
questions.explanation: John 10:41 states many said John did no miracle but all he spoke about Jesus was true.

medium.title: John Chapter 10 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from John Chapter 10 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with fear and doubt about following Jesus. Based on John 10, what biblical truth would you share about trusting Jesus as the shepherd?
options: Jesus is the good shepherd who knows His sheep and leads them safely
Jesus is a stranger whose voice the sheep do not recognize
Jesus is a hired worker who flees when danger comes
Jesus is a thief who seeks to steal and destroy
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus is the good shepherd who knows His sheep and leads them safely
questions.explanation: John 10:11,14-15 explain that Jesus is the good shepherd who knows His sheep, lays down His life for them, and leads them. This teaches us to trust Jesus for safety and guidance.

questions.question: How does John 10 teach about the importance of recognizing and obeying the voice of Jesus in our spiritual life?
options: Sheep hear the shepherd's voice and follow him because they know it
Sheep follow any voice they hear in the field
Sheep ignore their shepherd and listen to strangers
Sheep only follow the loudest voice they hear
questions.correctAnswer: Sheep hear the shepherd's voice and follow him because they know it
questions.explanation: John 10:3-5 show that the sheep hear the shepherd's voice, recognize it, and follow him, but they flee from strangers. This teaches believers to discern and obey Jesus' voice.

questions.question: A believer is concerned about eternal security and fears losing salvation. What assurance does John 10 provide?
options: No one can snatch the sheep out of Jesus' or the Father's hand
Salvation depends on constant human effort and is easily lost
The sheep can be plucked out by strangers if they are not careful
Salvation is temporary and can be revoked at any time
questions.correctAnswer: No one can snatch the sheep out of Jesus' or the Father's hand
questions.explanation: John 10:28-29 teaches that Jesus gives eternal life and no one can take the sheep from His or the Father's hand, giving believers assurance of eternal security.

questions.question: How does Jesus describe those who try to come into the sheepfold by other ways besides the door, and what practical lesson does this teach about integrity?
options: They are thieves and robbers, showing the importance of honest ways
They are faithful shepherds caring for the sheep
They are protectors who guard the sheep
They are helpers invited by the shepherd
questions.correctAnswer: They are thieves and robbers, showing the importance of honest ways
questions.explanation: John 10:1 explains that entering by other ways makes one a thief and robber, teaching believers to act with honesty and integrity in all matters.

questions.question: A church member is neglecting service because they only care for themselves. What warning from John 10 can help correct this attitude?
options: The hireling flees when the wolf comes because he does not care for the sheep
The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep
The sheep follow the voice of the shepherd
The door leads to pasture and safety
questions.correctAnswer: The hireling flees when the wolf comes because he does not care for the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:12-13 warn that the hireling, who is not the shepherd, flees and leaves the sheep vulnerable, highlighting the need for genuine care and responsibility in service.

questions.question: What does Jesus say about the purpose of His coming, and how does this relate to Christian hope in daily life?
options: Jesus came that we might have life and have it more abundantly
Jesus came only to judge and condemn
Jesus came to bring fear and uncertainty
Jesus came to impose strict laws without mercy
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus came that we might have life and have it more abundantly
questions.explanation: John 10:10 teaches that Jesus came to give abundant life, encouraging believers to live with hope and joy despite trials.

questions.question: According to John 10, how should believers respond to the works Jesus has done as evidence of His identity?
options: Believe in Jesus because His works testify of Him
Reject Jesus regardless of His works
Ignore Jesus' works and focus only on words
Wait for others to believe first
questions.correctAnswer: Believe in Jesus because His works testify of Him
questions.explanation: John 10:25 and 10:38 emphasize that Jesus' works bear witness to His identity and believers are called to trust Him based on these works.

questions.question: A believer faces opposition for their faith. How does John 10 encourage perseverance through trials?
options: Jesus has power to lay down His life and take it again, showing control over suffering
Believers should avoid all trials to stay safe
Opposition means God has abandoned them
They should give up if persecution is too hard
questions.correctAnswer: Jesus has power to lay down His life and take it again, showing control over suffering
questions.explanation: John 10:17-18 shows Jesus' voluntary sacrifice and authority over life and death, encouraging believers to trust God’s control despite trials.

questions.question: How does Jesus' statement 'I and my Father are one' (John 10:30) teach humility and reverence in Christian life?
options: It reveals Jesus' unity with God, calling for reverence and submission
It means Jesus is separate and unrelated to God
It suggests believers can be equal to God
It implies God and Jesus are rivals
questions.correctAnswer: It reveals Jesus' unity with God, calling for reverence and submission
questions.explanation: John 10:30 shows Jesus' divine unity with the Father, teaching believers to approach Him with humility and worship.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 10, the sheep will follow any voice they hear, even if it is a stranger's voice.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 10:5 states that sheep will not follow a stranger's voice but will flee from it because they do not recognize it.

questions.question: True or False: Jesus claims that He is the door to the sheepfold and that anyone entering by Him will be saved and find pasture.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: John 10:7-9 clearly states Jesus is the door, and those who enter by Him will be saved and have access to pasture, symbolizing safety and provision.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Jesus says, 'My sheep hear my _______, and I know them, and they follow me.'
options: voice
word
command
name
questions.correctAnswer: voice
questions.explanation: John 10:27 states that Jesus' sheep hear His voice, know Him, and follow Him, highlighting the importance of listening and obedience.

questions.question: How does John 10 illustrate the biblical virtue of sacrificial love in family and community life?
options: The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep
The hireling runs away when danger comes
The thief climbs up another way to steal
The stranger calls the sheep by name
questions.correctAnswer: The good shepherd lays down his life for the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:11 teaches that sacrificial love involves willingly giving oneself for others, a principle applicable in family and community relationships.

questions.question: A believer is struggling with recognizing false teachings. What does John 10 teach about discerning true leadership in the church?
options: True shepherds enter by the door and the sheep hear their voice
False teachers sneak in by the door to deceive
The hireling protects the sheep at all costs
Strangers’ voices are always trustworthy
questions.correctAnswer: True shepherds enter by the door and the sheep hear their voice
questions.explanation: John 10:1-3 clarifies that true leaders enter legitimately and the sheep recognize their voice, helping believers discern authentic spiritual guidance.

questions.question: What practical lesson about trust in God’s provision can be drawn from Jesus stating, 'I am the door: by me if any man enter in, he shall... find pasture'?
options: Trusting Jesus leads to spiritual nourishment and safety
Trusting Jesus leads to hardship and want
Trusting in wealth is more important than trusting Jesus
Pasture is irrelevant to spiritual life
questions.correctAnswer: Trusting Jesus leads to spiritual nourishment and safety
questions.explanation: John 10:9 teaches that entering through Jesus the door leads to salvation and provision, encouraging believers to rely on Him for their needs.

hard.title: John Chapter 10 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from John Chapter 10.

questions.question: In John 10, Jesus refers to Himself as 'the door of the sheep.' What Old Testament imagery is He invoking by this metaphor?
options: The protective gates of the Israelite temple
The door of the tabernacle in the wilderness
The entrance to the sheepfold as in Psalm 23
The gate of the city of Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The entrance to the sheepfold as in Psalm 23
questions.explanation: Jesus uses the door of the sheepfold imagery (John 10:7-9) which parallels Psalm 23 where the shepherd leads his sheep to pasture, emphasizing safety and access to life.

questions.question: What is the significance of Jesus stating, 'I and my Father are one' in John 10:30 in the context of Jewish monotheism?
options: He claims equality with God, a statement understood as blasphemy by His audience
He means they have the same mission but are distinct beings
He is emphasizing His role as a prophet like Moses
He is declaring political unity with the Jewish leaders
questions.correctAnswer: He claims equality with God, a statement understood as blasphemy by His audience
questions.explanation: In John 10:30, Jesus’ claim to oneness with the Father challenges Jewish monotheism and leads to accusations of blasphemy (John 10:31-33), indicating His divine nature.

questions.question: In John 10:11-13, Jesus contrasts Himself as the good shepherd with the hireling. What Old Testament passage does this shepherd imagery recall?
options: Ezekiel 34, where God condemns bad shepherds of Israel
Genesis 37, Joseph as a shepherd
Psalm 23, The Lord as Shepherd
Isaiah 40, The shepherd who tends his flock
questions.correctAnswer: Ezekiel 34, where God condemns bad shepherds of Israel
questions.explanation: The hireling imagery in John 10:11-13 echoes Ezekiel 34's condemnation of unfaithful shepherds, underscoring Jesus' role as the true protector of God’s people.

questions.question: How does the Greek word for 'hireling' (μισθωτός, misthōtos) used in John 10:12 enrich the meaning of the passage?
options: It implies a paid worker lacking personal commitment to the sheep
It means a slave bound to serve regardless of danger
It signifies a family member caring for the sheep
It denotes a thief who steals sheep
questions.correctAnswer: It implies a paid worker lacking personal commitment to the sheep
questions.explanation: The term 'hireling' (μισθωτός) in John 10:12 highlights someone motivated only by wages, not genuine care, contrasting with the good shepherd's sacrificial love.

questions.question: Which literary device is primarily used by Jesus in John 10:1-6 when describing the door and the shepherd?
options: Parable
Allegory
Simile
Hyperbole
questions.correctAnswer: Parable
questions.explanation: Jesus uses a parable in John 10:1-6 to illustrate spiritual truths about leadership, safety, and salvation through earthly imagery familiar to His audience.

questions.question: What theological theme in John 10:28-29 emphasizes the security of the believer?
options: Eternal security and divine protection
Human free will and choice
Moral accountability
Church discipline
questions.correctAnswer: Eternal security and divine protection
questions.explanation: Jesus promises eternal life and that no one can snatch His sheep from His or the Father's hand (John 10:28-29), highlighting the theme of eternal security.

questions.question: How does the statement in John 10:18 about Jesus laying down His life 'of myself' foreshadow New Testament Christology?
options: It anticipates the voluntary nature of His sacrificial death
It denies His death altogether
It emphasizes His weakness
It refers to His resurrection only
questions.correctAnswer: It anticipates the voluntary nature of His sacrificial death
questions.explanation: John 10:18 emphasizes Jesus’ sovereign authority to lay down His life, prefiguring the voluntary atonement central to Christian Christology.

questions.question: What is the cultural significance of sheep and shepherd imagery in the ancient Near East as reflected in John 10?
options: Sheep represented wealth and shepherds were figures of leadership and care
Sheep were considered unclean animals
Shepherds were despised and avoided by society
Sheepfolds were military fortresses
questions.correctAnswer: Sheep represented wealth and shepherds were figures of leadership and care
questions.explanation: In the ancient Near East, sheep were valuable property and shepherds symbolized responsible leadership, which Jesus leverages in John 10 to reveal His role as protector.

questions.question: In John 10:16, Jesus speaks of 'other sheep not of this fold.' What is the broader biblical implication of this statement?
options: Inclusion of Gentiles into God's people
Exclusion of Jews from salvation
Reference to a future messianic king
A parable about false teachers
questions.correctAnswer: Inclusion of Gentiles into God's people
questions.explanation: John 10:16 foreshadows the inclusion of Gentiles alongside Jews in the one flock under one shepherd, expanding salvation beyond Israel.

questions.question: What is the significance of the feast of the dedication mentioned in John 10:22 regarding Jesus’ discourse?
options: It is Hanukkah, commemorating temple rededication, underscoring Jesus’ claim as the true temple's shepherd
It is Passover, highlighting Jesus as the Lamb
It is Pentecost, symbolizing the Spirit’s arrival
It is Sukkot, signifying dwelling with God
questions.correctAnswer: It is Hanukkah, commemorating temple rededication, underscoring Jesus’ claim as the true temple's shepherd
questions.explanation: John 10:22 places Jesus’ teaching during the Feast of Dedication (Hanukkah), which celebrates temple purification, reinforcing His role as the true shepherd and temple.

questions.question: According to John 10:27, what evidences a true disciple of Jesus?
options: Hearing His voice, being known by Him, and following Him
Performing miracles
Observing strict ritual laws
Publicly preaching
questions.correctAnswer: Hearing His voice, being known by Him, and following Him
questions.explanation: John 10:27 identifies true disciples by their response to Jesus’ voice, their relationship with Him, and their obedience.

questions.question: What reason do the Jews give for attempting to stone Jesus in John 10:31-33, and how does it reflect their interpretation of His claims?
options: Blasphemy, because He, a man, makes Himself God
Political sedition against Rome
Teaching false doctrine about the Law
Breaking Sabbath laws
questions.correctAnswer: Blasphemy, because He, a man, makes Himself God
questions.explanation: In John 10:33, the Jews accuse Jesus of blasphemy for His divine claims, demonstrating their rejection of His messianic identity.

questions.question: How does Jesus use Psalm 82:6 in John 10:34 to defend His claim of divinity?
options: He points out that scripture refers to humans as 'gods,' so His claim is not blasphemous
He denies using the title 'Son of God'
He claims Psalm 82 supports His resurrection
He questions the authority of the Old Testament
questions.correctAnswer: He points out that scripture refers to humans as 'gods,' so His claim is not blasphemous
questions.explanation: John 10:34 references Psalm 82:6 to argue that if scripture applies 'gods' to humans, His divine sonship claim is consistent, challenging the blasphemy charge.

questions.question: What does the division among the Jews in John 10:19 reveal about the reception of Jesus' teaching?
options: His message was controversial and divided opinions
Everyone accepted Him immediately
They ignored Him completely
They unanimously condemned Him
questions.correctAnswer: His message was controversial and divided opinions
questions.explanation: John 10:19 shows that Jesus’ claims caused division, indicating the polarizing nature of His identity and teachings.

questions.question: True or False: According to John 10:41, John the Baptist performed miracles to validate his testimony about Jesus.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: John 10:41 states that John the Baptist did no miracles, but his testimony about Jesus was true.

theological.title: John Chapter 10 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from John Chapter 10 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to John 10, what is the significance of Jesus stating 'I am the door of the sheep'?
options: He is the exclusive means of salvation and access to God
He is simply a gatekeeper among many
He offers a metaphor for political leadership
He is a symbol of tradition and law
questions.correctAnswer: He is the exclusive means of salvation and access to God
questions.explanation: John 10:7-9 presents Jesus as the exclusive door to salvation, promising that through Him one shall be saved and find pasture. This aligns with passages like Acts 4:12 and Isaiah 35:8 which emphasize the exclusivity of God's provision for salvation.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean by 'My sheep hear my voice, and I know them, and they follow me' in John 10?
options: True believers recognize and respond to Christ's call
Sheep literally understand human speech
Only a few chosen hear the voice
Following is based on fear
questions.correctAnswer: True believers recognize and respond to Christ's call
questions.explanation: John 10:27 highlights the intimate knowledge between Christ and His followers, symbolizing the relationship between the believer and the Savior. This correlates with passages such as Ezekiel 34:11-16 and Psalm 23 which depict God's care for His people.

questions.question: In John 10, how is the 'hireling' contrasted with the 'good shepherd'?
options: The hireling flees at danger, while the good shepherd sacrifices for the sheep
The hireling works harder than the shepherd
The hireling protects the sheep better
The hireling is more knowledgeable
questions.correctAnswer: The hireling flees at danger, while the good shepherd sacrifices for the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:11-13 contrasts the selfless sacrifice of the good shepherd who lays down his life with the hireling who abandons the sheep for fear. This reflects the servant leadership model seen in Isaiah 53:7 and Philippians 2:6-8.

questions.question: What theological truth is affirmed when Jesus says, 'I and my Father are one' in John 10?
options: The unity of essence and purpose between Jesus and God the Father
Jesus is a mere prophet
Jesus is subordinate to the Father
Jesus is a created being
questions.correctAnswer: The unity of essence and purpose between Jesus and God the Father
questions.explanation: John 10:30 declares the divine unity, supporting the doctrine of the Trinity, consistent with passages such as John 1:1 and Colossians 2:9 affirming Christ's divinity and oneness with the Father.

questions.question: According to John 10, why do the Jews accuse Jesus of blasphemy?
options: Because He, being a man, calls Himself God
Because He broke the Sabbath
Because He claimed to be a prophet
Because He healed on the temple grounds
questions.correctAnswer: Because He, being a man, calls Himself God
questions.explanation: John 10:33 shows the Jews accusing Jesus of blasphemy due to His claim of divinity. This is consistent with the Old Testament law on blasphemy (Leviticus 24:16) and the New Testament affirmation of Christ's divine identity (Hebrews 1:3).

questions.question: How does Jesus defend His claim to be the Son of God in John 10?
options: By pointing to His works as witness
By quoting Old Testament prophets only
By denying the charge outright
By appealing to popular opinion
questions.correctAnswer: By pointing to His works as witness
questions.explanation: In John 10:37-38, Jesus invites His listeners to believe in His works as evidence of His divine mission, paralleling themes in John 5:36 and Romans 1:4 where divine authority is confirmed through miracles and resurrection.

questions.question: What does Jesus mean when He says, 'I lay down my life, that I might take it again' in John 10?
options: He voluntarily sacrifices Himself and has authority over life and death
He is uncertain about His fate
He expects someone else to save Him
He refers to a metaphorical death
questions.correctAnswer: He voluntarily sacrifices Himself and has authority over life and death
questions.explanation: John 10:17-18 emphasizes Christ's sovereign authority to lay down and take up His life, affirming His voluntary and redemptive death, consistent with Isaiah 53:10 and Philippians 2:8.

questions.question: What does John 10 reveal about the security of believers in Christ?
options: No one can snatch them from Jesus or the Father’s hand
Believers must constantly fight to maintain their salvation
Salvation is temporary and uncertain
Believers depend solely on their own strength
questions.correctAnswer: No one can snatch them from Jesus or the Father’s hand
questions.explanation: John 10:28-29 assures eternal security for believers, reflecting the doctrine of perseverance of the saints and God's sovereign protection, in harmony with Romans 8:38-39 and Ephesians 1:13-14.

questions.question: In John 10, what does the 'other sheep' mentioned by Jesus represent?
options: Gentiles or believers outside the Jewish fold who will be united in one flock
Literal sheep from another pasture
False teachers
Angels in heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Gentiles or believers outside the Jewish fold who will be united in one flock
questions.explanation: John 10:16 speaks of other sheep not of this fold, indicating the inclusion of Gentiles into God's people, a theme consistent with Ephesians 2:14-16 and Isaiah 56:6-8 on the inclusion of the nations.

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of the thief coming, according to Jesus in John 10?
options: To steal, kill, and destroy
To bring peace and life
To heal and restore
To preach repentance
questions.correctAnswer: To steal, kill, and destroy
questions.explanation: John 10:10 contrasts the thief’s destructive purpose with Jesus’ mission to give abundant life, resonating with 1 Peter 5:8 on the enemy’s intent and John 14:6 on Jesus as the life-giver.

questions.question: How does John 10 describe the relationship between Jesus and the Father?
options: They are one in essence and purpose
They are distant and unrelated
The Father is subordinate to Jesus
They disagree on salvation
questions.correctAnswer: They are one in essence and purpose
questions.explanation: John 10:30 states 'I and my Father are one,' asserting the unity of Jesus and the Father, reflecting Trinitarian doctrine as supported by John 1:1 and Hebrews 1:3.

questions.question: What role does Jesus claim in relation to the sheep in John 10?
options: He is the good shepherd who knows, protects, and lays down His life for the sheep
He is a hired hand indifferent to the sheep
He is an overseer who counts the sheep
He is a stranger to the sheep
questions.correctAnswer: He is the good shepherd who knows, protects, and lays down His life for the sheep
questions.explanation: John 10:11 and 14 describe Jesus as the good shepherd who intimately knows and sacrifices for His sheep, paralleling Psalm 23 and Ezekiel 34 emphasizing God's pastoral care.

questions.question: What response did Jesus’ claims in John 10 provoke among the Jews?
options: They were divided, some accusing Him of madness or possession, others marveling at His works
They unanimously accepted Him as the Messiah
They ignored Him completely
They immediately arrested Him
questions.correctAnswer: They were divided, some accusing Him of madness or possession, others marveling at His works
questions.explanation: John 10:19-21 records the division among the Jews with accusations of madness and demonic possession contrasted with acknowledgments of His miracles, aligning with reactions to prophets in 1 Kings 18 and Acts 3.

questions.question: In John 10, what is the significance of Jesus walking in Solomon's porch during the feast of dedication?
options: It situates Jesus in the temple during a major Jewish festival, highlighting His public ministry and confrontation
It shows He was avoiding crowds
It implies He was celebrating pagan rites
It indicates He was traveling outside Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: It situates Jesus in the temple during a major Jewish festival, highlighting His public ministry and confrontation
questions.explanation: John 10:22-23 places Jesus in the temple during the Feast of Dedication (Hanukkah), a significant Jewish festival, emphasizing His role in public teaching and foreshadowing conflict, consistent with themes in Luke 2:41-42 and John 7:14.

questions.question: What does Jesus say is the witness that validates His identity as the Christ in John 10?
options: The works He does in His Father's name
The testimony of the Pharisees
The political support He receives
The number of His followers
questions.correctAnswer: The works He does in His Father's name
questions.explanation: John 10:25 asserts that Jesus’ miraculous works bear witness to His divine identity, aligning with John 5:36 and Acts 2:22 which emphasize miracles as authenticating His messianic role.
